definition[0]: the quality of always being the same, doing things in the same way, having the same standards etc – used to show approval
example[0]: Consumer groups are demanding greater consistency in the labelling of food products.
example[1]: Consistency of performance depends on several factors.
example[2]: There are checks to ensure consistency between interviewers.
definition[1]: how thick, smooth etc a substance is
example[3]: Beat the mixture until it has the consistency of thick cream.
definition[2]: when a company uses the same accounting methods each year when it reports its results, so that the results can be easily compared
example[4]: In his chairman’s statement, he spoke of the need for consistency in financial matters.
